headline.main: A Q&A With Dr. Elizabeth Nabel

docs.abstract: Dr. Elizabeth Nabel (Photo: Doug Mills/The New York Times Dr. Elizabeth Nabel, a practicing cardiologist and researcher studying the genesis of plaque in coronary arteries, became director of the National Heart, Lung and Blood Institute on Feb. 1, 2005. A firm believer in prevention, she exercises vigorously nearly every day and can recite her blood [...]
docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Elizabeth Nabel, a practicing cardiologist and researcher studying the genesis of plaque in coronary arteries, became director of the National Heart, Lung and Blood Institute on Feb. 1, 2005. A firm believer in prevention, she exercises vigorously nearly every day and can recite her blood pressure, blood cholesterol and body mass index. Here are the five things she thinks everyone should know about heart disease.
